Incident.Summary: Vehicle was stopped in roadway, made contact with occupant who was intoxicated and had been operating vehicle under influence of alcohol.

IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText: L-17 is equipped with a MVR and it was not operational. I was equipped with a BWC and it was operational. Defendant: Santos Leonel Izaguirre Rodriguez Date Of Birth: 06/19/1980 Date Of Arrest: 12/18/23 Time Of Arrest: 0255 hours DUI#23-417 MD Drivers License #MD10272199349 Forestville Barrack VEHICLE IN MOTION (Phase 1) On Monday, December 18, 2023, at approximately 0224 hours, I, Senior Trooper Ortiz #5858 of the Maryland State Police Forestville Barrack was dispatched to a vehicle collision where a jeep was on its side on Southbound MD Rt 4 North of Ritchie Marlboro Road, Upper Marlboro, Prince Georges County, Maryland. The radio dispatch also advised a hispanic male was observed to be walking away from the scene. I arrived on scene and observed a White Hummer H3 bearing MD registration (4EZ7239) stopped in the middle of the road straddling lane 1 and lane 2. The vehicle was resting while facing at an angle and wasnt parallel with the road. I approached the vehicle and observed the drivers seat was empty. I looked at the front of the vehicle if there where any signs of damage to verify if this was the vehicle that was part of the initial description in the dispatch. I observed no damage on the vehicle. PERSONAL CONTACT (Phase 2) I next reached for the drivers door to see if it was left unlocked. The door was unlocked and when I shined my flashlight in the front row I didnt observe anyone. I shined my flashlight in the back row and due to my height and the Hummer being higher, I didnt immediately observe there was a male sitting on the second row passenger side seat and had his head tucked in to his jacket. Since I couldnt clearly see all the seats I called out Hello. I was surprised I got a verbal response which was difficult to discern due to the speech sounding slurred. I noticed the male occupant sticking his head out of his jacket. I observed the occupant was a hispanic male, who was later verbally identified as Santos Leonel Izaguirre Rodriguez. I asked Izaguirre Rodriguez who was driving the vehicle,and he replied nobody. I asked Nobody? and he reaffirmed Nobody. I asked why was the vehicle stopped in that spot? Izaguirre Rodriguez stated It just stopped here. I asked him again who was driving the vehicle though, and he again said nobody. I asked him are you alone in the vehicle or is there someone else with you and he stated Someone with me. Izaguirre Rodriguez then began to open the passenger side door to exit the vehicle and I told him to stay in the vehicle out of concern for his safety since traffic was passing around his vehicle on that side. Izaguirre Rodriguez was not obeying my instruction so I repeated my command in a stern voice and he asked why, I told him cause I am telling you to stay in your car. He scoffed at me and continued exiting the vehicle. I walked around to the other side and noticed Izaguirre had bloodshot and glass eyes, he struggled to maintain his balance while standing still. I asked him if he had any weapons and asked if I could pat him down and he stated it was okay. I asked Izaguirre Rodriguez to stand in the area between my patrol vehicle and his to avoid standing where cars where passing. While patting him down, Izaguirre Rodriguez said I have nothing on me, I have nothing, I just broke down what did you want me to do. I asked him if there was anyone else with him in the car and he replied I dont have anything I lost my wallet. I asked Izaguirre Rodriguez, So you where driving the car? He paused for a few seconds and said Yes, but like I told you the car ran out of gas I couldnt do anything. I asked Izaguirre Rodriguez how long hes been sitting there and he said like 10 minutes. I asked him where he was headed to and he said home. I asked him where he was coming from and he said From work to my house. I asked him if he had any alcoholic beverages and he said None. I asked him does his gas gauge work, and he said Of course. I asked him if it works then why didnt you gas up before running out of gas, and he said I was just on my way home. Once Tpr. Stacey and Tpr. Strawser arrived to assist, we where able to push the Hummer to the right shoulder. After confirming Izaguirre Rodriguez identity, I asked if he would be willing to submit to Three Standardized Field Sobriety Test. He agree to the test. PRE-ARREST SCREENING (Phase 3) The evaluation was performed on the right shoulder of Soutthbound MD Rt 4. The surface was wet, level, and free from any debris. The weather was cloudy and rainy. My patrol vehicle forward emergency lights were deactivated during all three tests. Izaguirre Rodriguez appeared to be in good physical condition and did not display any visible injuries. Izaguirre Rodriguez was asked the following questions: Glasses or Contacts - No Medical Conditions - No Injuries - No Medication - No Horizontal Gaze Nystagmus (6 of 6 clues observed) The first test was the Horizontal Gaze Nystagmus Test. The tip of my pen was used as the tests stimulus and held approximately 12 inches from Izaguirre Rodriguezs eyes. he was instructed to look straight ahead keep his head still while focusing on the tip of the stimulus with his eyes only. He was instructed to follow the tip of the pen with his eyes only until told to stop. His pupils were of equal size and showed equal tracking. -Lack of smooth pursuit in both eyes -Distinct and sustained nystagmus at maximum deviation in both eyes -Onset of nystagmus prior to 45 degrees in both eyes -Vertical gaze nystagmus not present. Walk And Turn (4 of 8 clues observed) Prior to Izaguirre Rodriguez performing the test, I clearly explained and demonstrated how the test should be performed twice. He was instructed to place his right foot directly in front of his left foot and touch heel to toe. He was instructed and demonstrated to place his hands flat at his sides and remain in that position until told to begin. He was instructed to keep his hands flat at his sides, keep his eyes focused on his feet, and to count every step aloud. On the ninth step, He was instructed to take a series of small steps around with his rear foot to turn completely around. He was instructed that the second series of nine steps were to be formed identical to the first series of nine steps. He was instructed that once the test started, that he should not stop walking until the test was completed. He was asked if he understood my instructions of the test, and he stated, Yes. Instructional Stage 335551671:1,335552541:0,335559683:0,335559684:-1,335559685:720,335559991:360,469769242:[65533,0,46],469777803:left,469777804:%1.,469777815:hybridMultilevel}" data-listid="10" role="listitem"> Broke the starting position on one occasion. Walking Stage: 2. Number of steps 3. The turn incorrectly performed 4. Arms from side One Leg Stand (3 of 4 clues observed) Prior to Izaguirre Rodriguez performing this test, I properly explained and demonstrated to him how the test should be conducted. He was instructed to stand with his feet together and hands down by his side while I provided instructions. I explained and demonstrated to him when I told him, he was to lift a foot of his choice off the ground approximately 6 inches off the ground and make it flat and parallel to the ground. I advised him to look down at his foot, keep arms by his side and count aloud one-one thousand, two-one thousand, and so until I advised him to stop. I asked him if he understood the instructions that were given, he stated Yes. While on scene, Izaguirre Rodriguez was offered and agreedto submit to a Preliminary Breath Test. PBT Results were .17 ARREST Izaguirre Rodriguez was placed under arrest at approximately 0255 hours, for Driving Under The Influence Of Alcohol. Izaguirre Rodriguez was transported to the Forestville Barrack for processing. While at the barrack Izaguirre Rodriguez mouth was check for any foreign objects. He was read his DR-15 Advice of Rights and he agreed to an intoximeter test at 0340 hours. INTOXIMETER RESULT: .15 BRAC. Izaguirre Rodriguez was issued all pertinent paperwork and was released to his wife from the Forestville Barrack. All events occurred in Prince Georges County, Maryland.
